bioghist.p: Jonathan Williams (1750-1815) was a merchant and soldier. He was the grandnephew of Benjamin Franklin, and served as the first Superintendent of West Point. He married Marianne Alexander of Edinburgh, Scotland. The couple lived at Mount Pleasant. Their daughter, Christine, married Thomas Biddle. Jonathan and Marianne Williams's son, Henry Jonathan (1791-1879), married Julia Rush (1792-1860), the daughter of Dr. Benjamin Rush. The Williams' daughter, Christine, married Thomas Biddle. Their son was Alexander Biddle.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of personal and business papers of the Williams family. Jonathan Williams papers (1778-1811) consist of personal and business correspondence, including McFarlan & Reilly's 1811 "Estimate of a Coachee for Col. Williams." Correspondents include Robert Alexander, William Alexander, and John Wheelock. Marianne Williams papers consist of personal letters dating from 1785 to 1813. Julia Rush Williams papers include her personal correspondence to her husband, and a commonplace book of religious extracts. The bulk of the collection consists of the papers of Henry Jonathan Williams, dating from 1815 to 1875. These include Williams's professional correspondence: documents related to the estates of Miss Bothia Alexander, Miss Elizabeth Stott, and Mrs. Maria Nixon; papers (taxes, rents, improvements) as agent and part owner of the Morrisville Estate; accounts of Jonathan Williams Biddle, also an agent of the Morrisville Estate; estate papers for members of the of the Rush family, including Dr. James Rush and Mrs. P.A. Rush; printed court transcripts, indentures, and deeds; articles of agreement; bills and receipts; household account books; and verses written to Williams by George Wilson. Williams's correspondents include: Horace Binney, John C. Bullitt, T. P. Carpenter, Frederick Graff, Hyman Gratz, Henry Harrison, Jared R. Ingersoll, William Jeffrey, Joseph S. Lewis, D. H. Nevins, Mrs. Maria Nixon, Ralph Peters, Richard Peters, John M. Read, George Sharswood, and Francis Gurney Smith. There is also one receipt book related to the Fame Insurance Company and an inventory of stock for the Crescent Factory.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Gift of the Moyerman family.
